org.semanticweb.owlapi.model
Interface OWLLiteral

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<OWLObject>, OWLAnnotationObject, OWLAnnotationValue, OWLObject, OWLPropertyAssertionObject
All Known Subinterfaces:
OWLStringLiteral, OWLTypedLiteral
All Known Implementing Classes:
OWLLiteralImpl, OWLStringLiteralImpl, OWLTypedLiteralImpl
public interface OWLLiteral
extends OWLObject, OWLAnnotationObject, OWLAnnotationValue, OWLPropertyAssertionObject

Author: Matthew Horridge
The University Of Manchester
Bio-Health Informatics Group Date: 24-Oct-2006

Represents a Literal in the OWL 2 Specification. Literals can either be typed literals ({@link org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLTypedLiteral) or untyped literals ({@link org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLStringLiteral).

Method Detail

getLiteral

java.lang.String getLiteral()
Gets the lexical value of this literal

Returns:
gets the lexical value of this literal

isOWLStringLiteral

boolean isOWLStringLiteral()
Determines if this literal is an instance of OWLStringLiteral

Returns:
true if this OWLLiteral is an instance of OWLStringLiteral

getLang

java.lang.String getLang()
Gets the language tag of this literal (if it is an OWLStringLiteral and has a langauge tag.

Returns:

If this OWLLiteral is an OWLStringLiteral:
If this OWLStringLiteral has a language tag the return value is the string that represents this language tag. If this OWLStringLiteral does not have a language tag then the return value is null.

If this OWLLiteral is an OWLTypedLiteral:
The return value is null (typed literals cannot have language tags).

hasLang

boolean hasLang(java.lang.String lang)
Determines if this OWLLiteral is an OWLStringLiteral and if so whether it has a specific language tag.

Parameters:
lang - The specific lang to test for.
Returns:

If this OWLLiteral is an OWLStringLiteral:
If this OWLStringLiteral has a language tag the return value is true if the language tag is equal to lang. If this OWLStringLiteral does not have a language tag then the return value is false.

If this OWLLiteral is an OWLTypedLiteral:
The return value is false (typed literals cannot have language tags).

isOWLTypedLiteral

boolean isOWLTypedLiteral()
Determines if this literal is an OWLTypedLiteral and is therefore typed with an OWLDatatype

Returns:
true if this literal is an instance of OWLTypedLiteral and false if this is not the case.

getDatatype

OWLDatatype getDatatype()
Gets the OWLDatatype which types this literal if it is an OWLTypedLiteral.

Returns:

If this literal is an OWLTypedLiteral then the return value is the OWLDatatype that types this literal.

If this literal is an OWLStringLiteral then the return value is null. (OWLStringLiterals are not typed).

asOWLTypedLiteral

OWLTypedLiteral asOWLTypedLiteral()
If this literal is a typed (i.e. if the isOWLTypedLiteral method returns true then this method obtains this literal as a typed literal. If isOWLTypedLiteral returns false then calling this method will cause an OWLRuntimeException to be thrown.

Returns:
This literal as an

asOWLStringLiteral

OWLStringLiteral asOWLStringLiteral()
If this literal is an RDFTextLiteral (i.e. if the isOWLTypedLiteral method returns false then this method obtains this literal as an RDFTextLiteral. If the isOWLTypedLiteral method returns true because this method is a typed literal, then calling this method will cause an OWLRuntimeException to be thrown.

Returns:
This literal as a more specific OWLStringLiteral
